instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message:
Hi,

This board came in with no image. Unfortunately my colleague went ahead and reflowed the GPU to diagnose this board before we spotted that this is notorious board for <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> problem. Now we have an image but question is did a temporary fix to GPU or to a cap? Is there a way to check it before we replace both?

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: Just replace the cap and see if it doesn't come back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: Okay. Will post here later if it comes back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: Replaced the cap. Put on Video stress test. Black image and system freeze after half an hour. GPU next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: What did you use for video testing? I find that Furmark never crashes after replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> and Heaven just always crashes no matter what.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: I use Cinebench for quick CPU and GPU test and FURMARK for long stress test. Now it doesnt even want to boot -> black screen. Back to the original problem before GPU reflow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: Not wanting to boot is not a common GPU issue. Does it still chime? Vcore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: Agreed. That is why I am not jumping straight to GPU replacement on this one. No chime on boot and no image only fan spin. NVRAM reset doesnt work. This morning I was able to boot it again but it crashed in Furmark immediately.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: Could be anything. Vcore present when board does not boot? Bad RAM slot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message:
Tried using single ram in different slot - no success
GPU VCORE - present
CPU VCORE -  present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: I wouldn't bother with this one as it could be anything. But if you have time to waste the common issue is the MUX and/or GPU/VRAM.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Video problems
threads.message: No sir, I am a very busy man. Topic closed.
